details.content: Senior Software Engineer with 10+ years of experience in developer tooling, infrastructure platforms, and scalable distributed systems.

Key contributor to multiple flagship AWS projects including CDK, Amplify Swift, and VPC Lattice. Deeply skilled in modern languages like TypeScript, Swift, Java, and Rust, with a strong passion for functional programming, reproducible builds, and dev productivity.
Track record of diagnosing performance bottlenecks and delivering measurable improvements in developer experience and system reliability.

details.label: Programming Languages
details.content: Javascript/Typescript, Java, Swift/Obj-C, Ruby, Python, Rust, C/C++, Haskell

details.label: AWS CDK
content: Maintainer and contributor to the aws/aws-cdk open-source project, enabling infrastructure as code in TypeScript, Python, Java, and Go.
Designed and demonstrated a Nix-based bundling PoC for AWS Lambda, addressing customer needs for customizable, reproducible build environments.

Though not merged upstream, insights from this PoC were later applied to optimize CDK documentation build processes—reducing build time from 2+ hours to under 30 minutes using deterministic and cacheable steps via Nix.
Supported multiple AWS services in CDK libraries and improved developer ergonomics through better abstractions and dependency isolation.

details.label: AWS Amplify for Apple platforms
content: Maintainer of aws-amplify/amplify-swift, the official iOS SDK for AppSync, Auth, and Storage.
Implemented a real-time AppSync client using URLSession and Combine, providing first-class native GraphQL subscription support.
Designed and shipped an ApolloGraphQL-compatible extension for customers needing more control over schema and caching.
Migrated CI/CD pipelines from CircleCI to GitHub Actions and integrated AWS Secrets Manager, improving deployment reliability and security.

details.label: EC2 Load Balancing - VPC Lattice
content: Contributed to AWS VPC Lattice, a scalable network service mesh platform.
Designed high-consistency DynamoDB schemas for listeners, rules, and target groups; implemented REST APIs and DAO layers for the service control plane.

details.label: Amazon Selling Partner Services
content: Built a deferred accounting engine to process over 10 million daily financial transactions for Amazon’s third-party seller ecosystem.
Introduced a functional-style Result monad to model partial failures and error recovery paths cleanly, improving testability and long-term maintainability.
This pattern enabled more robust error handling and simplified integration of new features into an otherwise complex financial system.

details.label: VoIP Web App
details.content: Maintained and enhanced the VoIP web application, ensuring seamless integration with CRM platforms such as Salesforce and Zendesk.

details.label: XiaoTaoJiang
details.content: Redesigned and developed an e-commerce store iOS app using the latest WebKit framework. The app is hybrid, with the UI rendered in WebView and all asynchronous requests managed by native Swift code.

details.label: QRCode Scanner
details.content: An iOS app for scanning and reading QR codes in Japan, automatically crawling and comparing prices across Amazon, Yahoo, and other Japanese online stores. The crawlers were developed in JavaScript, with the app serving as the orchestrator.

details.label: Customized Linux Firmware
details.content: Designed and developed a Wi-Fi packet sniffing agent that detects Wi-Fi probe requests to regularly publish nearby devices. It is built on a Broadcom MIPS Linux system. Additionally, integrated iBeacon functionality into the Wi-Fi device using its onboard BLE chip.

details.label: Wi-Fi Setup Smart Wizard
details.content: Designed and developed an iOS app for the initial setup of a Wi-Fi device using Bluetooth protocol.

details.label: DirectReader
details.content: Designed and developed a cloud drive management app that enables users to easily share files between desktop and mobile devices.

title: Chungnam National University
Daejeon, South Korea
subtitle: Bachelor of Engineering in Computer Engineering
Mar. 2007 -- Mar. 2011
